snippet: New York’s police commissioner once said the use of stop-and-frisk tactics “sowed new seeds of community mistrust,” but now he offers no apology for the approach.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column decries Police Commissioner Raymond Kelly's use of stop-and-frisk tactics, which he once opposed; says such tactics are biased, ineffective and the cynical last resort of a public official who can imagine nothing better than the flawed present.
lead_paragraph: New York’s police commissioner once said the use of stop-and-frisk tactics “sowed new seeds of community mistrust,” but now he offers no apology for the approach.

headline.print_headline: Former Skeptic Now Embraces Divisive Tactic
headline.seo: Time for Kelly to Drop Stop-and-Frisk in New York
headline.main: Former Skeptic Now Embraces Divisive Tactic
